meanings.definition: A medication used to treat tuberculosis.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed ethambutol to cure the illness.
meanings.sent2: She took ethambutol every day to get better.
meanings.sent3: The ethambutol bottle danced on the shelf, ready to fight the sickness.
meanings.sent4: Ethambutol was a warrior against the tuberculosis bacteria.
meanings.sent5: The bright orange ethambutol pills were like tiny soldiers battling the disease.

meanings.definition: To administer ethambutol to a patient.
meanings.sent1: The nurse ethambutol-ed the patient as part of the treatment.
meanings.sent2: Doctors ethambutol patients to help them recover.
meanings.sent3: The caregiver ethambutol-ed the patient with a smile.
meanings.sent4: She ethambutol-ed the medicine into the patient's hand gently.
meanings.sent5: The medical team ethambutol-ed the dose carefully to ensure effectiveness.

meanings.definition: The ethambutol prescription was filled at the pharmacy.
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist handed over the ethambutol prescription to the customer.
meanings.sent2: The ethambutol prescription was ready for pick up at the pharmacy.
meanings.sent3: The ethambutol prescription sat on the counter, waiting to be collected.
meanings.sent4: The ethambutol prescription brought hope to the patient.
meanings.sent5: The ethambutol prescription label had clear instructions for use.
